item.title: Did Apple Just Kill Social Apps?

item.title: ‘Every job is going to change pretty radically,’ many in the next year, thanks to AI, says Indeed’s CEO
item.description: AI isn't a fad like blockchain or the metaverse, says Hyams. It will have as much impact on business as the birth of the World Wide Web.

item.title: In Israel, Rosh Hashana, the Jewish New Year, Is More Bitter Than Sweet
item.description: On Rosh Hashana, many Israelis longed for a return to normalcy after a year of escalating wars for the country.

item.title: Israeli Strikes on Gaza Schools and an Orphanage Kill Scores of Palestinians
item.description: The Palestinian Authority’s official news agency said the Israeli military operation had included an incursion by ground troops and airstrikes.

item.title: A Storm, a Strike and War Abroad Pose Challenges for Harris
item.description: Scenes of striking workers, hurricane devastation in the Southeast and missiles over Israel represent a rare moment of turbulence for Kamala Harris.

item.title: Markets remain mixed on Middle East news
item.description: Markets continued to cool off from the record highs reached last week.

item.title: Israel Says at Least 8 Soldiers Are Killed in Clashes With Hezbollah in Lebanon
item.description: The cross-border fighting appeared to be the first direct ground confrontation between the two sides since Israel invaded Lebanon this week.
